disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Wednesday 13 April to end of Wednesday 13 April GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Increasingly warm with sunny spells Wednesday interspersed with cloudier periods and scattered showers.<br/><br/>There should also be enough air movement to prevent the build-up of local emissions in a light 'clean' south westerly Atlantic airflow.<br/><br/>Overall air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Thursday 14 April to end of Thursday 14 April GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Cloud cover forecast for Thursday morning, will clear early afternoon with periods of sunshine, continuing to be warm. Some build-up of local emissions close to roadside locations during morning rush hour, in relatively calm conditions. Any build-up is expected to disperse from late morning in a light 'clean' south westerly Atlantic airflow.<br/><br/>Overall air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>
